alert.note: Alert for Butler; Edmonson; Grayson; Ohio; Warren (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 9:58AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Butler, southwestern Grayson, northwestern Warren, southeastern Ohio and northern Edmonson Counties through 930 AM CST... At 857 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Morgantown, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Grayson, northwestern Warren, northern Edmonson, Butler and southeastern Ohio Counties, including the following locations... Roundhill, Mining City, Dimple, Aberdeen, Black Gold, Leetown, Eden, Caneyville, Flint Springs and Rockland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until noon CST for south central and central Kentucky.
